title: Comforting Meatloaf with Mashed Potatoes

description: Indulge in this hearty meatloaf with creamy mashed potatoes and cheese. It's the ultimate comfort food that brings warmth to your dinner table. Try this easy recipe for a cozy family meal tonight!
instructions: In a large bowl, combine ground beef, breadcrumbs, milk, ketchup, egg, salt, and pepper. Mix until well combined.
Shape the mixture into a loaf and place it in a baking dish.
Bake for 30 minutes or until cooked through.
While the meatloaf is baking, prepare the mashed potatoes according to your favorite recipe.
Once the meatloaf is done, top it with shredded cheese and return to the oven for an additional 5 minutes until the cheese is melted.
Serve the meatloaf with a generous helping of mashed potatoes.
tips: For the best flavor, let the meatloaf rest for a few minutes before slicing. This helps keep it juicy.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Cook the meatloaf until it reaches an internal temperature of 160°F (70°C) for safety.
  • Avoid overmixing the meat to keep it tender.
  • Look for a nice golden crust on the outside as a sign it's ready.
  • Store leftovers in the fridge and reheat gently in the oven.

structured_content.content: This dish is a family favorite, often made for gatherings and celebrations. It brings back memories of laughter and love around the dinner table.
Try adding herbs like parsley or thyme for extra flavor, or mix in some sautéed onions and garlic for depth.
Pair with steamed vegetables or a fresh salad for a balanced meal. A glass of red wine complements the flavors beautifully.
For a healthier twist, substitute ground turkey or chicken. You can also make mini meatloaves for individual servings.
